result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonchristen O Pinkston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200.00 BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS/DNA. Balance to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12/15/15; alternate 8 days jail.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonchristen O Pinkston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jonchristen O Pinkston in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.    The defendant was sentenced to the following:   COSTS: $243.00 &  DNA SURCHARGE $200.00.  Apply cash bail and balance to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 12/15/15, failure to pay 8 days jail consecutive as penalty.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. DNA SURCHARGE: 200.00.   Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant Jonchristen O Pinkston in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin requests that case be held over to tomorrow, 10/23/15.  Court grants request and adjourns to tomorrow.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing at 10-22-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Jonchristen O Pinkston in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant took the road test but was unsuccessful. Defendant will sign up for the easy road test. Court will set 14CT692 for jury status/jury trial. 14CT923, 15CM758 and 15CM1163 to trail along on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Jonchristen O Pinkston in court, in custody.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Katie Bricco appears as friend of the court.  Defendant can have free phone calls to obtain bail.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
The Court does not forfeit bond as the Defendant failed to sign the signature bond ordered by the Court on 5/6/15.

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Jonchristen O Pinkston did not appear at 11:15 a.m..   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias - Br. 9 only.

Br. 9 - only
from file 14CT692
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
Hearing on June 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Jonchristen O Pinkston did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court received a call that the defendant could not obtain a ride to court. Court stays a capias until the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on June 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on May 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Jonchristen O Pinkston in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received the criminal complaint - reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defense requests another date on May 20, 2015. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
